description: 100 multiple‑choice questions derived from instructional content (excludes exercises/knowledge checks).

questions.text: Which statement best defines Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) as described in the guide?
options: A file repository for project documents
A coding convention for agile teams only
A test-only methodology without design or deployment
A strategic process managing a product from idea to design, development, testing, deployment, and end of life

questions.text: Which benefit is explicitly listed among ALM’s key benefits?
Why does the guide emphasize ALM coordination for modern products?
options: Small scripts can replace all embedded software
Teams work best in isolation without shared processes
Complex products include large software codebases requiring multi‑team orchestration

questions.text: What primary role does Codebeamer play within ALM?
options: It is a CAD modeling tool
It is a general email client
It provides end‑to‑end traceability in a collaborative, role‑based platform
It is a desktop spreadsheet tool

questions.text: Which functional areas are highlighted in Codebeamer’s lifecycle visualization?
options: Image editing, social media scheduling, blogging
Printer queue management, file compression, desktop themes
Requirements management, test management, release management, analytics, dashboards

questions.text: In Codebeamer, trackers are most closely comparable to what?
options: Tables in a relational database defining fields and relationships

questions.text: What are tracker items within a tracker?
options: Individual records such as requirements or tasks

questions.text: What is true about parent/child hierarchy among tracker items?
options: It improves readability but does not create logical dependencies

questions.text: Which default trackers are commonly included in a blank project?
options: Customer Requirements, System Requirements, Tasks, Bugs, Test Runs, Releases, Test Sets, Test Cases, Test Configurations
Device Drivers, Kernel Modules, OS Logs

questions.text: What do references represent in Codebeamer’s tracker hierarchy?
options: Upstream/downstream links between items across trackers

questions.text: In the Configuration Diagram, arrows point in which direction?
What do state transitions define for tracker items?
options: Allowed status changes throughout an item’s lifecycle

questions.text: According to the Customer Requirement workflow example, what can happen to an Accepted item?
options: It may be rolled back to Draft before being set to Rejected
It must jump directly to Completed

questions.text: Which view shows a three‑pane layout (tracker tree, item list, properties)?
Which view displays items as rows and attributes as columns?
Which view organizes work by status and can group by assignee?
Which additional views are highlighted for analysis and editing?
options: CPU monitor, Memory profiler, Disk defragmenter
FTP client, Remote desktop, SSH terminal
Theme editor, Icon picker, Palette manager
Document edit view, Traceability report, Test coverage browser

questions.text: What is the purpose of the Library in Codebeamer?
options: Reuse tracker items across projects and trackers

questions.text: When adding projects to the Library, what items appear in its tree?
options: Only non‑empty trackers from those projects

questions.text: Which Agile elements are supported by the built‑in Agile Planner?
options: Releases, sprints, product backlog, release/sprint backlog

questions.text: What can a release be used for in relation to tasks?
options: Tasks can be assigned to specific releases for scheduling
Releases cannot be linked to tasks

questions.text: Which statement best defines a Test Configuration?
options: A documented product condition under which a test is executed
A list of unrelated bug IDs

questions.text: What does a Test Case include?
options: Descriptions, pre‑actions, detailed steps, and post‑actions

questions.text: How is a Test Run described?
options: Execution of a test case using one release and one configuration

questions.text: What does a Test Set represent?
options: A set of operating system users
A logical group of related test cases with allowed releases/configurations

questions.text: What integration does the guide emphasize for test management?
options: Integration with requirements, tasks, bugs, and source for traceability

questions.text: What does cbQL stand for?
Which capabilities are listed under Data Visualization and Reporting?
options: Encrypt emails, compress files, stream music
Paint icons, crop images, animate banners
Filter tracker items, generate reports, create wiki pages
Provision servers, compile kernels, flash firmware

questions.text: What are Data Visualization Widgets used for?
options: Displaying report data on dashboards (20+ widgets available)

questions.text: Which tracker views allow export to Microsoft Office per the guide?
What can filters in tracker views do?
options: Narrow items by fields such as Status and Assigned To

questions.text: Where can private saved views be found?
options: Under ‘My Private Views’ in the list of available views

questions.text: Which widget lists recent actions and who performed them?
What does the Tracker List widget display when configured with detailed layout?
options: Tracker items and key attributes for selected tracker types

questions.text: What is a good reason to switch the Wiki layout to a single pane?
options: To make large widgets like Traceability Report fully visible

questions.text: What challenge did Navya face before adopting Codebeamer?
options: Overreliance on a single integrated ALM tool
No use of software in products
Traceability and visibility issues due to disparate tools (Git, spreadsheets, Jira)

questions.text: What solution did Codebeamer provide for Navya’s teams?
options: End‑to‑end visibility with standardized policies and traceability

questions.text: What outcome is described when anti‑collision software testing fails?
options: A bug is recorded, and the Scrum Master reprioritizes tasks linked to safety requirements

questions.text: Why do industry project templates matter?
options: They accelerate setup with built‑in artifacts, logic, and best practices

questions.text: Which deliverables align with Agile concepts in ALM?
options: Epics (customer requirements), user stories (system requirements), tasks (sprints), test runs

questions.text: Which tracker type includes start and end dates per the example?
options: Release trackers include only version strings
Requirement trackers include end dates; tasks never have dates
Task trackers include start/end dates; requirement trackers do not
Bug trackers include sprint dates only

questions.text: What is the purpose of Workflow Diagrams for trackers?
options: To visualize allowed status transitions and rollbacks

questions.text: What can Document Edit view be used for?
options: Inline editing of multiple items while reading tracker content

questions.text: What does the Test Coverage Browser summarize?
options: Recent test runs and pass/fail coverage

questions.text: Why combine multiple filters in a tracker view?
options: To create focused lists (e.g., Status=New AND Assigned To=Yuming)

questions.text: What is a typical use of Traceability Report?
options: Visualizing upstream and downstream relationships across levels

questions.text: What can Mass Edit accomplish in some trackers?
options: Apply identical changes (e.g., status or comments) to multiple items

questions.text: Why might you switch a requirements tracker to Table view?
options: For a compact, scannable list of filtered items

questions.text: Which feature supports Kanban practices?
options: Built‑in Kanban Board with WIP limits

questions.text: What does ‘Assigned To’ filter help visualize?
What is an example of downstream linking from a system requirement?
options: Switching CAD units from mm to inches
Deploying a mobile app to a store
Creating a task derived from the requirement

questions.text: How can a Scrum Master react to QA failure on a task?
options: Lock the workflow to prevent changes
Use Kanban to move the task back to ToDo or In Progress

questions.text: Where would you expect to see role‑based dashboards?
options: Within Codebeamer’s analytics and widget framework

questions.text: What do report jobs enable?
options: Scheduling and sharing of reports via email

questions.text: Which entities can a test case be linked to for full traceability?
What is a practical use of the Library’s drag‑and‑drop linking?
options: Create references between items across trackers/projects

questions.text: Which pane shows properties of a selected item in Document view?
Why is end‑to‑end traceability important for compliance?
options: It links requirements through testing to release for auditability

questions.text: Which concept aligns customer requirements to downstream development?
options: System requirements derived from customer requirements

questions.text: Which Codebeamer capability strengthens project transparency #60?
options: Dashboards and reports built from traceable project data

options: Dashboards and reports built from traceable project data
